performance_metrics.name: Code Review Coverage Rate
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of code commits that are automatically reviewed by the system. This should include both automated checks and potentially human-in-the-loop reviews based on risk level.

performance_metrics.name: Review Turnaround Time (Mean)
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken from code commit to completion of review. This includes automated checks, human review, and any necessary revisions.

performance_metrics.name: Bug Detection Rate (Post-Review)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of bugs identified *after* the automated review process has completed, indicating the effectiveness of the review system.  This should be tracked over time to assess improvements.

performance_metrics.name: False Positive Rate (Automated Checks)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of automated checks that incorrectly flag code as problematic. Minimizing this is crucial for efficiency.

performance_metrics.name: Reviewer Utilization Rate
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of available reviewer time actively spent on code review tasks.  Accounts for training, meetings, and other responsibilities.

performance_metrics.name: Code Complexity Score Increase (Post-Review)
performance_metrics.description: Change in Cyclomatic Complexity after review – Indicates the system doesn't unduly add complexity to the codebase.

implementation_requirements.name: Code Repository Integration
implementation_requirements.specifications: Seamless integration with existing code repositories (Git, SVN, etc.) with support for branching and merging strategies.  API access required for automated triggers.
implementation_requirements.description: The system must integrate directly into the development workflow, triggering reviews automatically upon code commit.

implementation_requirements.name: Rule Engine Configuration
implementation_requirements.specifications: Configurable rule engine supporting multiple rule types: static analysis, code style checks, security vulnerabilities, and potentially custom rules.  Rules should be adjustable via a user interface.
implementation_requirements.description: The system must allow for defining and modifying code review rules based on project needs.

implementation_requirements.name: User Interface (UI) and Reporting
implementation_requirements.specifications: Intuitive UI for reviewers and developers. Real-time tracking of review status. Generation of detailed reports on code review activity, rule violations, and overall quality.
implementation_requirements.description: A user-friendly interface is essential for efficient workflow management and reporting.

implementation_requirements.name: Scalability
implementation_requirements.specifications: The system should be able to handle 100-1000 concurrent code review requests with a response time of < 10 seconds.
implementation_requirements.description: Designed for large-scale development teams and projects.

implementation_requirements.name: Security Integration
implementation_requirements.specifications: Integration with security scanning tools (SAST, DAST). Reporting of security vulnerabilities directly within the review workflow.
implementation_requirements.description: Proactive identification and remediation of security risks.

implementation_requirements.name: API Access
implementation_requirements.specifications: Comprehensive API for integration with CI/CD pipelines and other development tools. Support for webhooks and real-time event notifications.
implementation_requirements.description: Allows for fully automated and integrated workflows.

industry_standards: IEEE Std 1475-2017 – Software Testing – Software Review
operational_considerations: Training and Onboarding: Provide comprehensive training to developers and reviewers on the system's usage and configuration.
Rule Tuning: Continuously monitor and adjust review rules to minimize false positives and ensure effectiveness.
Workflow Integration: Establish a clear and well-defined code review workflow to maximize efficiency.
Feedback Loops: Implement mechanisms for gathering feedback from developers and reviewers to improve the system.
Governance and Compliance: Establish policies and procedures to ensure compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations.
Resource Allocation: Properly allocate human resources for training, configuration, and ongoing support.
